name: Knocked Loose
biography_excerpt: Knocked Loose is an American hardcore punk band from Oldham County, Kentucky, formed in 2013 and currently signed to Pure Noise Records. The band released its first studio album, Laugh Tracks, in September 2016 through Pure Noise Records.

name: Spiritbox
biography_excerpt: Spiritbox is a Canadian metal band from Vancouver Island, British Columbia.  The group employs several musical styles and has been described as progressive metal, djent, and metalcore, among other genres. Singer Courtney LaPlante has cited Tesseract, Deftones, and Kate Bush as influences.

name: Sleep Token
biography_excerpt:
Sleep Token are a British rock collective. Their second album This Place Will Become Your Tomb was elected by Loudwire as the 12th best rock/metal album of 2021.

name: Periphery
biography_excerpt: Periphery is an American progressive metal band formed in Washington, D.C. in 2005. Their musical style has been described as progressive metal, djent, and progressive metalcore. They are considered one of the pioneers of the djent movement within progressive metal. They have also received a Grammy

name: Lamb of God
biography_excerpt: Lamb of God is an American heavy metal band from Richmond, Virginia. Formed in 1990, the group consists of vocalist Randy Blythe, guitarists Mark Morton and Willie Adler, bassist John Campbell, and drummer Chris Adler. name: Erra
biography_excerpt: "Erra"  is a five piece progressive metalcore band hailing from Birmingham, Alabama recovered from ex members of "By Blood and Iron", a band that caught a lot of attention from "Death Metal" listeners. name: Whitechapel
biography_excerpt: "Whitechapel" is an American deathcore band from Knoxville, TN.  The band has a recurring theme of Jack the Ripper, hence being named after the area of London (England) where the killer found his victims. name: Kublai Khan TX
biography_excerpt: Kublai Khan TX come from Sherman, Texas — a small town in the north of the state — and were formed in 2009 by a group of friends straight out of high school. name: Born of Osiris
biography_excerpt: Born of Osiris is an American deathcore band, formed in 2003 in Chicago. name: Bilmuri
biography_excerpt: Bilmuri is a American one man alternative/pop rock/post-hardcore project founded by  former Attack Attack! member Johnny Franck in 2016. name: Thrown
biography_excerpt: Thrown is a hardcore and metalcore band from Sweden that formed in 2020 around ex-Grieved singer Marcus Lundqvist, drummer Buster Odeholm, guitarist Johan Liljeblad and Andreas Malm.

name: Lorna Shore
biography_excerpt: Lorna Shore is an American deathcore band formed in New Jersey in 2009. name: Bad Omens
biography_excerpt: Bad Omens is an American metalcore band from Richmond, Virginia formed in 2015 by frontman Noah Sebastian, guitarist Nicholas Ruffilo, and bassist Vincent Riquier. name: Turnstile
biography_excerpt: Turnstile are an American hardcore punk band from Baltimore, Maryland, formed in 2010. They have released five EPs and three studio albums. name: Architects
biography_excerpt: Architects are a British metalcore band from Brighton, England, formed in 2004. name: Wage War

name: Veil of Maya

name: Animals As Leaders
biography_excerpt: Animals as Leaders is an American instrumental progressive metal band, formed by guitarist Tosin Abasi in 2007 which now includes guitarist Javier Reyes and drummer Matt Garstka. name: Dayseeker
biography_excerpt: An expansive progressive metalcore band hailing from Orange County, California, Dayseeker make explosive anthems with a melodic, arena rock flair. name: Trivium
biography_excerpt: Trivium were formed in Orlando, Florida in 1999, when a teenage Matt Heafy impressed with a Metallica cover at a school talent show and was recruited into the band as guitarist — only to take over as vocalist shortly after. name: August Burns Red

name: Loathe
biography_excerpt: Loathe are an English alternative metal band from Liverpool, England. name: Polaris
biography_excerpt: While Toronto has long been known for the grittier side of drum-n-bass music, the Romanian-born, classically trained Polaris brings an altogether different sound to the fore. name: Silent Planet
biography_excerpt: "Silent Planet"  are a Los Angeles-based metalcore band whose music embraces dynamics swinging from quiet, atmospheric contemplation to a full-on sonic assault, and whose lyrics offer a thoughtful view of the challenges of life in a destructive, chaotic world. name: Fit For A King
biography_excerpt: Fit for a King, also known as FFAK, is an American metalcore band from Tyler, Texas formed in 2007. The band comprises drummer Jared Easterling, vocalist Ryan Kirby, bassist Ryan "Tuck" O'Leary and guitarist Daniel Gailey. name: Dance Gavin Dance
biography_excerpt:
"Dance Gavin Dance" is a post-hardcore band formed in Sacramento, California in 2005.

name: After The Burial

name: Like Moths To Flames
biography_excerpt: Like Moths to Flames is an American metalcore band from Columbus, Ohio, formed in 2010 by former members of various bands, including Agraceful, the Crimson Armada, and My Ticket Home. name: Rivers of Nihil

name: Between the Buried and Me
biography_excerpt: Between the Buried and Me is a thinking man's hardcore unit hailing from Raleigh, North Carolina. name: A Day To Remember
biography_excerpt: A Day to Remember (sometimes shortened to ADTR) is an American rock band from Ocala, Florida, founded in 2003 by guitarist Tom Denney and drummer Bobby Scruggs. name: Underoath
biography_excerpt:
Underoath (stylized as Underøath) was an American Christian metalcore band from Tampa, Florida. Founded by Dallas Taylor and Luke Morton on November 30, 1997 in Ocala, Florida, subsequently its additional members were from Tampa, Florida.

name: Northlane
biography_excerpt:
Northlane is an Australian metalcore band from Sydney, New South Wales. Founded in 2009, the band have one EP, Hollow Existence and one studio album, Discoveries. They are currently signed to We Are Unified and Distort Entertainment.

name: Bring Me the Horizon

name: The Ghost Inside
biography_excerpt:

name: Converge
biography_excerpt: Converge is an American hardcore band from Salem, Massachusetts formed in 1990. name: Code Orange
biography_excerpt: Code Orange (formerly Code Orange Kids) is an American hardcore punk band that formed in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania in 2008. name: Pierce the Veil
biography_excerpt: Pierce the Veil is an American post-hardcore band from San Diego, California. name: Avenged Sevenfold

Avenged Sevenfold (often abbreviated A7X) is an American heavy metal band from Huntington Beach, California. Formed in 1999, the group consists of M. Shadows (vocalist), Synyster Gates (lead guitarist), Zacky Vengeance (rhythm guitarist), and Johnny Christ (bassist).

name: Parkway Drive
biography_excerpt: Parkway Drive is an Australian metalcore band from Byron Bay, New South Wales, formed in 2003. name: Thrice
biography_excerpt:
Thrice is an American rock band from Irvine, California, formed in 1998. The group was founded by guitarist/vocalist Dustin Kensrue and guitarist Teppei Teranishi while they were in high school.

name: Atreyu

name: Bullet for My Valentine
biography_excerpt: Bullet for My Valentine are a Welsh heavy metal band from Bridgend, formed in 1998. name: Killswitch Engage
biography_excerpt: Killswitch Engage is an American metalcore band from Westfield, Massachusetts, formed in 1999 after the dismantlement of Overcast and Aftershock. name: The Word Alive
biography_excerpt: The Word Alive is an American metalcore band from Phoenix, Arizona. Formed in 2008, the band is signed to Fearless Records. name: Falling in Reverse
biography_excerpt: Falling in Reverse is an American band signed to Epitaph Records. They released their debut album, The Drug in Me Is You, on July 26, 2011, which peaked at number 19 on the Billboard 200, selling 18,000 copies in its first week of sales. name: Babymetal
biography_excerpt: Babymetal  (stylized as BABYMETAL) are a Japanese kawaii metal band. name: Halestorm
biography_excerpt: Siblings Arejay and Elizabeth "Lzzy" Hale have been actively writing and performing original music since 1997 when they were 10 and 13 years old, respectively. name: In This Moment

name: My Chemical Romance
biography_excerpt: My Chemical Romance is an American alternative rock band from New Jersey, formed in 2001. name: Taking Back Sunday

name: Coheed and Cambria
biography_excerpt:
Coheed and Cambria is an American rock band from Nyack, New York. Formed in 1995, the group incorporates aspects of progressive rock, punk rock, metal and post-hardcore.

name: Make Them Suffer
biography_excerpt: Make Them Suffer is an Australian deathcore band from Perth, Australia. They formed in 2007 and currently are signed to Roadrunner Records. name: Volumes
biography_excerpt: Volumes is an American metalcore band from Los Angeles, California. The band formed in 2009 and have since released the EP The Concept of Dreaming, the full-length album Via and are currently planning to release their second full-length album No Sleep this year (2014).

name: The Used
biography_excerpt: The members of the Used had to overcome poverty, homelessness, and substance abuse, not to mention the straitlaced attitudes of their hometown of Orem, Utah, to bring their screamo-tinged brand of post-hardcore to life. name: Soil
biography_excerpt: Soil, often typeset as SOiL, is an American metal band that formed in Chicago, Illinois in 1997. After some independent releases, the band was the first rock group signed to J Records and achieved mainstream success with their major label debut, Scars, in 2001.
